questions.question_text:
A company reeds help managing multiple AWS linked accounts that are reported on a consolidated bill.

Which AWS Supped plan includes an AWS concierge whom the company can ask for assistance?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. AWS Enterprise Support

Selected Answer: B
B - Enterprise Support

B - AWS Enterprise support.

AWS Enterprise support plan includes an AWS concierge who acts as a single point of contact for the customer and provides personalized guidance and support to help the customer use AWS services effectively. This includes assistance with managing multiple AWS linked accounts reported on a consolidated bill, as well as other enterprise-level support features such as 24/7 access to support engineers, architectural guidance, and AWS Trusted Advisor checks

questions.question_text:
A company wants to use a managed service to simplify the setup operation, and scaling of its MySQL database in the AWS Cloud.

Which AWS service will meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Amazon RDS

"Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) is a collection of managed services that makes it simple to set up, operate, and scale databases in the cloud. Choose from seven popular engines — Amazon Aurora with MySQL compatibility, Amazon Aurora with PostgreSQL compatibility, MySQL, MariaDB, PostgreSQL, Oracle, and SQL Server — and deploy on-premises with Amazon RDS on AWS Outposts."

https://aws.amazon.com/rds/

Selected Answer: B
B is answer

Selected Answer: C
C. AWS Organizations

"AWS Organizations is an account management service that enables you to consolidate multiple AWS accounts into an organization that you create and centrally manage. AWS Organizations includes account management and consolidated billing capabilities that enable you to better meet the budgetary, security, and compliance needs of your business. As an administrator of an organization, you can create accounts in your organization and invite existing accounts to join the organization."

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/organizations/latest/userguide/orgs_introduction.html

Selected Answer: C
One of the benefits of AWS Organizations is the ability to consolidate billing across multiple AWS accounts. By creating an organization within AWS Organizations, you can link multiple accounts together and set up a payment method for the organization. This allows you to receive a single bill for all the linked accounts, making it easier to manage and track costs across your organization.

questions.question_text: Which AWS service or tool otters consolidated billing?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. AWS Organizations

Selected Answer: A
https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/mt/automate-account-creation-and-resource-provisioning-using-aws-service-catalog-aws-organizations-and-aws-lambda/

comments.content:
You have the correct reference but you chose the wrong answer. This is from that same website: 
"AWS Organizations offers policy-based management for multiple AWS accounts. With AWS Organizations, you can create groups of accounts, automate account creation, apply and manage policies for those groups."

Therefore, the correct answer is B - AWS Organizations

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
AWS Organizations offers policy-based management for multiple AWS accounts. With AWS Organizations, you can create groups of accounts, automate account creation, apply and manage policies for those groups.
https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/mt/automate-account-creation-and-resource-provisioning-using-aws-service-catalog-aws-organizations-and-aws-lambda/

Selected Answer: B
B. AWS Organizations

Selected Answer: B
B. AWS Organizations

The correct answer is:

B. AWS Organizations

AWS Organizations helps you centrally manage and govern your environment as you grow and scale your AWS resources. It allows you to create new AWS accounts and apply service control policies (SCPs) that centrally control AWS service use across multiple AWS accounts. An SCP could be set up to prevent all users from creating Amazon EC2 instances.

AWS Organizations is the correct answer because it provides centralized management of AWS accounts and allows you to create and manage accounts in batches using AWS Organizations' account creation APIs. You can also create Service Control Policies (SCPs) to manage permissions across all the accounts in the organization, which allows you to prevent all users from creating Amazon EC2 instances.

Selected Answer: B
AWS Organizations provides this type of capability.

B. AWS Organizations - enables a company to centrally manage and govern multiple AWS accounts. It provides features such as consolidated billing, access control, and policy-based management of AWS resources across multiple accounts.

questions.question_text:
A company wants to automate the creation of new AWS accounts and automatically prevent all users from creating Amazon EC2 instances.

Which AWS service provides this functionally?

A company wants to design its cloud architecture so that its workloads are resilient, can consistently perform their intended functions correctly, and can recover from failure quickly.

Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework does this architecture represent?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The answer is (D)

Reliability Pillar

The reliability pillar focuses on workloads performing their intended functions and how to recover quickly from failure to meet demands. Key topics include distributed system design, recovery planning, and adapting to changing requirements.

Performance Efficiency Pillar

The performance efficiency pillar focuses on structured and streamlined allocation of IT and computing resources. Key topics include selecting resource types and sizes optimized for workload requirements, monitoring performance, and maintaining efficiency as business needs evolve.

Selected Answer: D
D. Reliability

"The Reliability pillar encompasses the ability of a workload to perform its intended function correctly and consistently when it’s expected to. This includes the ability to operate and test the workload through its total lifecycle. "

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/framework/reliability.html
D is the correct
i also say D the keyword here is recover
